page.title: 12My Great Grandmother
page.content: My Great Gran came to live in Church End which is about the oldest part of Cherry Hinton in her early 'teens.' There was a tap in the middle of the road which supplied the area with water.In 1920 she went to work at the cement works which are now closed down.They worked 12 hours a day.The cement works were then used for crushing old iron and steel to put on the land.The larger pieces were picked out so that the machines did not get broken.They had no tranport to get into town for shopping so they had to walk to Mill Road where they could catch a bus which was a horse and cart.It cost one penny.She told me how Cherry Hinton has changed.It is now a small town.
